question: Alexander Lukashenko has been re-elected as the President of which country?
explanation:
The President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko has recently won a landslide re-election victory, as per the countryâ€™s central Election Commission.
As per the figures of the votes counted, around 80 per cent of the votes were secured by the President. His main rival Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, won over 9 per cent of the votes. At least one person was killed and dozens were injured in the clashes held during the elections.
